item.title: Israel, Hezbollah exchange heaviest strikes in months, raising regional tension
item.dc:creator: Steve Hendrix, Mohamad El Chamaa, John Hudson, Susannah George, Suzan Haidamous
item.description: The dramatic but contained escalation overnight Sunday stopped short of all-out war, with Hezbollah and Israel signaling restraint.

item.dc:creator: Niha Masih, Rachel Pannett, Mohamad El Chamaa, Leo Sands, Annabelle Timsit, Ben Brasch
item.description: Israel said it preemptively struck Hezbollah targets to foil an attack from the group. The escalation in Israel and Lebanon comes ahead of Gaza cease-fire talks in Cairo.

item.title: Telegram founder Pavel Durov detained in France

item.title: French police arrest suspect in arson attack on synagogue
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan
item.description: Authorities had opened a terrorism investigation into the attack on a synagogue in La Grande-Motte in southern France.

item.title: German authorities say suspect in deadly knife attack now in custody
item.dc:creator: Kate Brady, Victoria Bisset, Jennifer Hassan, Steffi Hentschke
item.description: The attack took place Friday in Solingen in western Germany, where residents had gathered for a festival. Officials said they had not ruled out terrorism.

item.title: Hamas delegates in Cairo as Gaza cease-fire talks resume
item.dc:creator: Susannah George, Adela Suliman, Mohamad El Chamaa, Kelsey Ables
item.description: The Hamas delegation is not expected to participate directly in the talks, but they will be briefed on the negotiations by Egypt and Qatar, officials said.

item.title: Italy opens manslaughter investigation into Sicily yacht sinking
item.dc:creator: Victoria Bisset, Stefano Pitrelli, Adela Suliman
item.description: Italian prosecutors say no suspect has been idenitifed in the investigation into the deaths of seven people after Monday’s sinking of the Bayesian.

item.title: Ukraine keeps crossing Russia’s red lines. Putin keeps blinking.
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon, Catherine Belton
item.description: Ukraine’s punch through Russian defenses in the first foreign invasion since World War II has laid bare Moscow’s apparently illusory red lines.

item.title: Europe’s most dangerous volcano rumbles, and Italians weigh the risk
item.dc:creator: Anthony Faiola, Stefano Pitrelli
item.description: As the Phlegraean Fields volcano awakens, scientists debate the peril posed by a monster thought to have caused the most violent eruption of pre-historic Europe.

item.title: Australia offers U.S. a vast new military launchpad in China conflict
item.dc:creator: Michael E. Miller
item.description: Australia is expanding its northern military bases, with U.S. support, to counter China's growing threat. Critics quip it’s become the “51st state.”

item.title: South Koreans once chipped in for fighter jets. Now, they make their own.
item.dc:creator: Michelle Lee
item.description: The U.S. Phantom F-4 fighter jet, which South Korea has just retired from use, acts as a metaphor for the countries’ security alliance. It’s also a hell of a ride.

item.title: U.S. debates support for Ukraine’s surprise offensive into Russia
item.dc:creator: Karen DeYoung, Alex Horton, Isabelle Khurshudyan
item.description: Caught unaware by Ukraine’s military incursion into Russia, the Biden administration is debating whether to help Kyiv’s forces hold the sliver of territory they now occupy.

item.title: U.S. calls Lopez Obrador reforms ‘major risk’ to democracy; Mexico protests
item.dc:creator: Mary Beth Sheridan
item.description: The Mexican president Lopez Obrador rejects U.S. criticism about his radical judicial reform. The dispute comes as the U.S. is relying on Mexico to contain migration during a presidential campaign.

item.title: U.S. insists Gaza cease-fire deal is close, but diplomats are skeptical
item.dc:creator: John Hudson, Steve Hendrix, Heba Farouk Mahfouz
item.description: U.S. officials have insisted that negotiations for a cease-fire in Gaza were making headway, while glossing over intense disagreements between Israel and Hamas.

item.title: India’s Modi visits Ukraine, urges Zelensky to hold peace talks
item.dc:creator: Gerry Shih
item.description: The Indian prime minister’s trip to the Ukrainian capital, Kyiv, came after his visit to Moscow last month, which was sharply criticized by Zelensky.
